history.text: I was surprised to find out that Benedict Cumberbatch was in this movie
Do you feel this movie was accurate?
I really like him. I saw the movie and liked it. It has a really high score on rotten tomatoes
It is definitely an instant classic.
I don't actually know too much about Alan Turing. I guess the movie wasn't accurate?
It seems to take liberties with its source material.
I know that he was gay and he ate a cyanide pill. That was in the movie. I know he invented the machine that would become the computer
But it is a film, and not a documentary so I guess that's not unusual.
It seems that Turing's actual story is very compelling - a shame they had to embellish.
True. It has to be interesting to keep the audience's attention.
However it was beautifully written
I thought the Imitation Game as a concept is what led to Do Android's dream about electric sheep which would become Bladerunner?
I liked it a lot. I really thought Benedict Cumberbatch was amazing in the role. He is such a chameleon
I do not know about that, but it does talk about them trying to decrypt the Enigma machine.
It was so sad about about his loving Christopher so much who died
It seems Turing was bullied at boarding school - I guess working with codes was less stressful than dealing with bullies.
But Christopher did spark his interest in cryptology
He was such an amazing mind to live in an age where being gay was illegal. So sad
Interesting that he named the machine Christopher
Yeah he never forgot him
And that it was to be destroyed by Denniston.
I liked Keira Knightley in the movie too
But then he married - which seems odd.
Yes she is good.
Oh yeah that was right about the Enigma machine being destroyed. Very emotional scene
I liked how they figured out how to break the code with the weather announcement
Feel really bad for Clarke. You would think she would have known he was gay, but it seems she was blind to it.
And then Caimcross being a spy !!
and then Turing confronts him and all heck breaks loose!
Yeah. Also so emotional that they couldn't act on every message that they had to stand by while they knew people would die
Or else they would realize they could decode them
hard thing to have to do
Then they had to keep everything that they had done secret
then to tell them they had to split up and could never talk about it or see each other again
And Christopher got Turing interested in code breaking. Christopher was such a huge influence
